artist.name: Aayushman Parmar
artist.bio: Aayushman Parmar is an independent artist and producer exploring introspection, generational identity, and emotional nuance through jazz-rap influenced soundscapes. His work examines the subtle tensions between parents and children in Indian households — not through extremes, but through the quieter, internalized pressures and unspoken fears that shape relationships.

albums.title: Manah Kalah
albums.albumBio: Manah Kalah is a jazz-rap driven, deeply personal album centered around family, generational tension, and emotional growth. The narrative follows a child’s evolving perception of family — beginning with internalized pressure and quiet resentment, and gradually shifting toward empathy and appreciation. The emotional turning point arrives at 'I Promise, I'm Alive.' The project highlights the subtle divide present in many Indian households: children often hesitate to share their struggles, while parents silently worry without expressing it. Rather than portraying dramatic rebellion or oppression, the album explores invisible expectations and unspoken fears. Through shifting tone, perspective, and instrumentation, the record builds an empathy bridge between generations — showing that misunderstanding often stems not from malice, but from love expressed imperfectly.

blog.title: The Making of Manah Kalah
blog.excerpt: A deeper look into the emotional arc and themes behind the album.
blog.content: Manah Kalah was created as a cohesive narrative exploring identity, pressure, silence, and generational empathy. Each track builds on the album’s arc — moving from introspection and internal conflict toward openness and reconciliation.
